alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 16 at 6:40AM MST until February 16 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT TODAY FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... After poor humidity recoveries for the east central plains last night, strong southwest winds will return today with gusts reaching up to 50 mph. Relatively humidity will drop below 15 percent this afternoon, and high temperatures will vary from around 5 to 10 degrees above seasonal averages, with another round of critical fire weather conditions expected from late this morning through early evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...East-central plains from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to around 50 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 8 to 13 percent this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
